Description: Mould-made pottery plastic lamp in the form of an elephant's head, the corrugated trunk forming a round-tipped nozzle. The filling-hole is on top of the head and is surrounded by a raised rim. The unpierced handle behind the head is decorated with a small triangular feature with a raised loop. The handle-spine is decorated at each end with a notched angular panel with a double ridge. The roughly circular base is flat below. Covered with a pinkish-red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q616)
